quote_first: “When did you next see Dr. Wellesley?”“At just
quote_last: .”“Where?”“In the surgery.”“He came back there?”“Yes.”“How do you fix that precise time–eleven minutes to eight?”“Because he’d arranged to see a patient in Meadow Gate at ten minutes to eight. I glanced at the clock as he came in, saw what time it was, and reminded him of the appointment.”
title: In the Mayor's Parlour
author: J.S. Fletcher

quote_last: .”“You’re always right; there must be a clock in your head.”“I can’t be wrong, tonight. I’ll be able to tell you one second before they blast off. Look! The ten-minute warning!”
title: The End of the Beginning
author: Ray Bradbury
